item_category: Nokia 2.4 is ready for you. Keep the energy up with 2-day Adaptive Battery technology, take detailed night shots with AI imaging and easily unlock with your fingerprint or a glance. The impressive 6.5-inch HD+ 20:9 screen will bring your stories to life. Plus, Nokia 2.4 is ready for Android 11 and beyond so you can look forward to 2 years of Android upgrades and 3 years of monthly security updates.

I purchased this little gem of a phone, the purple colour spoke to me. I say little, nevertheless the screen is a decent size. This phone suits anyone who enjoys watching Youtube, music and taking the odd selfie or landscape pics. Easy to use overall very happy with my purchase :D
Easy to use Nokia. I have used a Nokia 3.1 for a few years now and it was time to upgrade. It is bigger in size than my old phone but that is to be expected with a bigger memory.
Good battery life so far, use phone for calls, social media, not the 2 day battery life, but pretty close at a day and a half!

It is a very good phone especially for teenagers because has the features kids need also good for watching videos and downloading apps. Nokia brands are a popular choice now for mobile hand sets and I would definitely recommend the phone. Has other apps installed too which is helpful.

I bought this to replace my old, cracked phone and I didn't want to spend a lot because I don't need all the bells and whistles and loads of storage.

It's easy to use and set up, pretty intuitive for most things. The screen is massive which is great for watching stuff, but this means the phone itself is quite large. If you have small hands are and prone to fumbling and dropping stuff (like me) you might want to choose a smaller option.

Apps are very slow to open, difficult to pick up calls, have to constantly press the answer button when phone rings to enable me to accept the call, call drops ,constantly freezes. Finger print open doesn't work 80% of the time. I use for delivery job and it froze in the middle of me trying to accept a delivery, hence loss of money as had to turn  off to get my delivery app working again which is when it took 10 mins to turn back on again. Hence lost out on at least 3 jobs in that time. Rubbish!

This is a good strong phone resent model so quite new model l like Nokia always strong hardware  battery last two days with normal use very impressive. The only problem it doesn't have NFC which means you can't use contactless payment with Google pay l was little bit disappointed with that . Overall it's a good value phone l would recommend it.

The in phone is pretty lightweight for its size, slimline and stylish. I love the great purple colour.

Got this for my elderly mother to view photos ect. Is very easy to use as android 10 is customisable so I was able to display only call, text, camera and WhatsApp on her home screen. If she is still stuck she can press the Google assistant button on the side and tell it what to do instead aswell as tell it to show her things on Google or play her songs. After the doro being very basic at an eye watering price or the I phone being hard to navigate for her this phone is a breath of fresh air.

Pros:
Battery life is great 
Phone is super responsive 
Photo quality is good  
There is a lot of security options for access to the phone etc

Cons:

Nice looking phone and good value for money, but with a few quirks. It is quite large, especially the length, and tends to stick out of a pocket. It also misses out on a light (for example to indicate a message). It's also impossible to remove some google apps, and has a very irritating Google Assistant button on one edge of the phone which can't be disabled, and is easy to accidentally press many times a day. Other than that a good phone, especially supporting two SIMs and a memory card!
The Google assistant button is annoying
Definitely would recommend this to anyone who is looking to buy a moblie phone

Loving this phone so far! Bought to replace an old one and can't fault it! Battery lasts ages and is so easy to use. Only took a few minutes to set up and swap things over from old phone, up and running in no time! Bargain for a sim free smartphone, would recommend to others.

A wonderful smart phone, my friend brought it me as a birthday gift (well gave me the money) and as my old Nokia 6 phone screen was broken I decided to get a new one with my birthday money. So we bought this phone for a 9-year olds Christmas present it was their first mobile phone. They absolutely loved it! 
It has a big screen and is easy for them to hold in their hands. Access to a massive world of apps through the android marketplace and great parental controls for our piece of mind.
The phone has a really premium look and feel, for the price it's fab! 
I couldn't be happier!

For a shade under £100 you get a heck of a lot for your money, a 6.5" (720p) display, 13mp main camera, 2mp depth sensor & 5mp selfie. The MediaTek Helio P22 is a decent processer and coming from a Snapdragon 765G 5G processer it's not too noticeable thanks to the clean and smooth Stock Android & pack in the 2 years of security & software updates & excellent build quality it's the best £100 you could spend & this is coming from a man used to £600-1000 flagships. Great for parents & grandparents.

I chose this phone for its price and large screen size of 6.5" but it has some annoying traits. 
1) if you receive a call you have to unlock the phone to end the call when finished!
2) On Bluetooth in the car, if you are taking a call and your kid presses eg Netflix, you then have both going off at the same time!
3) To go back to front screen you have to swipe from the bottom but it will open other recent apps first so it takes several swipes!
4) Fingerprint sensor doesn't work at all well !
